subject: Welcome to the Divided States of America
body:
Companies fighting the backlash; homelessness hits all-time high; the white guy in DEI  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 January 21, 2025
Yesterday's US presidential inauguration brought some difficult news for DEI supporters and many others. But we are also starting to see some pushback against the idea of eliminating DEI from corporations. Ultimately, the calls for eliminating DEI are not grounded in logical business arguments, and while some leaders may believe that DEI is bad for their companies and customers, even more leaders appreciate the value of creating more diverse, inclusive, and equitable organizations. Perhaps instead of just renaming the Gulf of Mexico, we should rename the entire country to the “Divided States of America”…
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them!
Congratulations to the amazing Ali Ingersoll for releasing her inspiring booklet, 
Keep Moving Forward
—don't miss it! And it's great to see a number of companies like 
Apple
, 
Amazon
, 
Microsoft
 and 
many others
 speaking out against the anti-DEI backlash. Also good to see that 
Walmart's investors
 are expressing their disappointment with its recent retrenchment (some links were already shared above).
 
 
Aleria Team Updates
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Ready to start your 
Journey to Inclusion
?
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. Our four-stage 
Journey to Inclusion
 is ideally suited for organizations with 500 or more employees, regardless of your current level of DEI readiness. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
On January 22, 2025 at 8am US/ET, join a Women in Technology Virtual Forum, where inspiring technology leaders Cecilia Mao of Equifax and Jennifer Remling of Warner Bros. Discovery will share practical advice to help you excel in the competitive business landscape. 
$25 for registration
Also on January 22, 2025, at 3pm US/ET, join organizational psychologist Dr. Tiffany Jameson, and Ivan Stanojkovic, neuro-inclusion expert at grit & flow, for a free LinkedIn training session. They'll provide the latest science-backed strategies for optimizing evaluations in 2025 for lasting employee retention and thriving organizations. 
Free registration.
On February 3, 2025 at 3-4pm US/ET join 
Explore Career Paths for Women in Operations
, a FairyGodBoss event with Dana Diep and Lindsey Goad of Enovis, for a conversation about how to climb in your operations career, as well as about the importance of uplifting other women alongside you in the workplace. 
Free registration.
On February 12, 2025 at 12-1pm US/ET join Aleria's Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano for 
DEI IN 2025: A Sustainable Approach
. This webinar shows how organizations can navigate the backlash and transform challenges into opportunities. Discover how to continue supporting all employees while achieving superior financial performance, paving the way for meaningful and lasting impact. 
Free registration
.
 
Spread the love!
If you enjoy the Aleria newsletter, forward it to a friend or colleague!
If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.
SUBSCRIBE
101 Avenue of the Americas, FL 9
New York, NY 10013, USA
If wish to stop receiving this newsletter, please send us an email at 
info@aleria.tech
. If you wish to stop receiving all Aleria-related communications, please use the Unsubscribe link below.

subject: 🌟 Call for Proposals Are Open: Showcase Your Work at Learning 2025! 🌟
body:
Submit your proposals today!
View this email online.
Hi Dustin,
In case you missed it, we’re excited to announce that the 
Learning Leadership Conference 2025 Call for Proposals
 is open! This is an excellent opportunity for all L&D professionals to contribute ideas, insights, and strategies for shaping the next generation of learning.
We are actively seeking proposals on a variety of topics, including but not limited to:
•  Artificial Intelligence in learning and development
•  Learning Strategies for evolving environments
•  Leadership in the modern workplace
•  Team Building and collaboration in virtual and hybrid settings
•  And much more!
If you have a topic or session idea that you believe will drive innovative thinking and action for the future of learning, we want to hear from you. Your contributions will not only aid in developing the next generation of learning leaders, but your ideas will be implemented throughout organizations for the foreseeable future.
Make your ideas come to life at the Learning Leadership Conference 2025!
SUBMIT YOUR PROPOSAL
How to Submit:
Deadline:
 Proposals are due by Friday, January 31, at 11:59 PM PT.
Submission Form: 
Submit here
Details:
 Please provide a brief overview of your proposed session, including objectives, key takeaways, and any relevant experience.
But Don't Just Take Our Word For It...
Hear how speaking at the Learning Conference has changed impacted a previous speaker:
“I was in a tough slot at the end of the conference, but I was really very happy with the level of excitement and engagement that I saw with the folks that were taking part in the session.”
Sarah Arkins
, Instructional Clarity
In Case You Missed It...
The Learning Leadership Conference 2025 has been moved to 
October 1-3, 2025
, and we’re heading to the gorgeous 
Rosen Centre Hotel in Orlando, FL!
 🌴 Get ready for a world-class venue, vibrant energy, and the perfect setting to make memories that will last.
The clock is ticking, so don’t miss your chance to be a part of this game-changing conference. Submit your proposal TODAY and help us shape the future of learning!
We can’t wait to hear from you and see you in Orlando!
Best,
The Learning Leadership Conference Team
Ready to get started? We've compiled resources like submission tips, potential proposal topics, and top proposal examples to support you. Remember to submit your proposal by January 31, 2025 at 11:59 P.M.
Note: Vendors are not eligible to submit a proposal for the Learning Leadership Conference 2025 at this time.
 
View Proposal Materials
Copyright © 2025 
The Learning Guild
. All Rights Reserved. 
Privacy Policy
 and 
Terms of Use Agreement
.
Guild OPT OUT Information
: This email was sent to 
dustin@lcwmail.com
. If you would like to unsubscribe from Learning Guild emails, 
click here to update your contact preferences
. You may also contact us at The Learning Guild, 266 West 489 5th Ave, 5th Floor, New York, NY, 10017, United States or +1.707.566.8990 or email 
service@LearningGuild.com
.

LA Strong
SUPPORTING COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY WILDFIRES
With a fifth of our team based in Los Angeles and countless friends and family who call it home, LA holds a special place in our hearts. 
The recent wildfires have brought immense challenges to the region, deeply affecting many local businesses, including our brand partners and neighbors. At Goody, we’re committed to supporting this vibrant community in every way we can. 
One meaningful way you can join us is by shopping small and local. We’re proud to partner with over a dozen incredible LA-based businesses that could truly use your support right now.
Support LA Businesses
 
 
Brightland
Fresh, family farm-to-table California-grown olive oils and vinegars are full of flavor, beautifully bottled
Gift Brightland →
 
Ghia
Alcohol-free aperitivo, with intoxicating flavor you’ll never forget
Gift Ghia →
 
Zac's Sweet Shop
A dessert company and local gem based in LA, creating insanely delicious bite-sized nostalgia
Gift Zac's →
 
Gifts
 that make an 
impact
With every Goody you send, you can add a $1 or $5 donation to a charity. By allowing recipients to swap their gifts, you also give them the option to donate their gift to a charity of their choice.
 
 
 
Gift a Donation

subject: Do you want to speak at the 2025 Learning Leaders Conference?
body:
Submit your proposal before January 31!
View this email online.
Hi Dustin,
Are you ready to share your voice and inspire the next generation of L&D leaders? 
The Learning 2025 Call for Proposals
 is officially open, and I would like to invite you to submit your proposal to speak at our event. This is your chance to take the stage and share your expertise with the L&D community. Even better—if your session is accepted, you would get a free full-conference registration! 
The Learning Leaders Conference, October 1-3, in Orlando, Florida, will bring together current and aspiring L&D leaders who are committed to growth—for themselves, their teams, and their organizations. If this aligns with your vision and experience, now is the time to submit your proposal!
SUBMIT YOUR PROPOSAL
What You Need to Know
 
Deadline
: Proposals are due by Friday, January 31, at 11:59 PM PT. 
Diverse Topics
: We’re looking for dynamic sessions covering a range of topics, such as leadership, aligning L&D with business goals, integrating AI into your training and work, learning strategy, team building, and so much more. Don’t hold back—if your idea could transform the way L&D teams work, we want to hear about it! 
Engaging Formats
: From interactive discussions and small-group activities to panels and case studies, we’re looking for sessions that captivate and challenge attendees. Think about how your session can deliver the most value and energy to your audience. 
Audience Impact
: Sessions that provide actionable solutions, relatable case studies, or forward-thinking strategies are more likely to be selected. Show us how your session can make a difference! 
Take this opportunity to showcase your expertise, contribute to the growth of the L&D community, and become part of the inspiring lineup at Learning 2025. 
Submit Your Proposal Today! Don’t wait—share your vision and apply now. We can’t wait to see your ideas! 
SUBMIT YOUR PROPOSAL
For more information on the program focus for Learning 2025 and what we look for in proposals, check out our 
frequently asked questions
 before submitting your work. If you have any questions or need assistance, don’t hesitate to contact our team at 
Programs@LearningGuild.com
. We look forward to re
viewing your Learning 2025 speaking proposal! 
Best, 
Pam Hogle 
Program Manager, 
The Learning Leaders Conference
Note: Vendors are not eligible to submit a proposal for Learning 2025: The Learning Leaders Conference.
 
Copyright © 2025 
The Learning Guild
. All Rights Reserved.

 and

.

subject: 2025 is off to a good start!
body:
Costco rejects anti-DEI proposal; sticking it to wealthy students; lots of Aleria updates  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 January 07, 2025
Happy 2025! We hope you enjoyed some peace and quiet during the recent break, and that you are energized about the new year. After a string of DEI defections, there is significant excitement about the news that Costco's Board has rejected a shareholder proposal challenging its DEI activities. Beyond the rebuttal itself, there is reason to hope that this could mark the beginning of challenges to the anti-DEI ideologues that are doing nothing more than fomenting polarization and wasting money. Let's hope that 2025 marks the year when the anti-DEI backlash is recognized for what it is: empty, malevolent rhetoric of no value.
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them!
Congratulations to 
Simone Biles
 for being selected as the 
2024 Sportsperson of the Year
 by 
Sports Illustrated
, not just for her amazing achievements as an athlete, but for changing the face of the sport, and for being an advocate for mental health. Congratulations also to a long-time friend of ours, 
Lola Banjo
, for the 
great feature story
 describing her success creating and growing the 
Silver & Riley
 brand, whose iconic bags and other luxury products are now available at Nordstrom and Saks.
 
 
Aleria Team Updates
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Aleria Media Round-up
Listen to the podcast 
Debunking the Merit vs. Diversity Myth: A Data-Driven Approach with Paolo Gaudiano
Check out Paolo's own reflections about the Costco rebuttal in his Forbes blog titled 
Costco's Rebuttal Reveals The Cost Of Anti-DEI Efforts
Take a deeper dive into the TIDI framework in Paolo's LinkedIn newsletter, 
The Complexity of Inclusion
.
Enjoy the video recordings from the 
2024 Diversity & Inclusion Research Conference
, which include two different presentations by Team Aleria.
Ready to start your 
Journey to Inclusion
?
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. Our four-stage 
Journey to Inclusion
 is ideally suited for organizations with 500 or more employees, regardless of your current level of DEI readiness. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
On January 15, 2025 at 2:00 PM US/ET, join panelists from the Navy Federal Credit Union for “How to Promote Employee Mental Health,” a conversation about the importance of mental health in the workplace. Brought to you by our friends at FairyGodBoss. 
Free registration
.
On January 16, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join Jennifer Brown for a 
Community Call
 with Eduardo Placer, a former professional stage actor turned public speaking coach for presidential candidates, global nonprofits, and Fortune 500 companies. 
Free registration
On January 22, 2025 at 8am US/ET, join a Women in Technology Virtual Forum, where inspiring technology leaders Cecilia Mao of Equifax and Jennifer Remling of Warner Bros. Discovery will share practical advice to help you excel in the competitive business landscape. 
$25 for registration
 
Spread the love!
If you enjoy the Aleria newsletter, forward it to a friend or colleague!
If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.
SUBSCRIBE
101 Avenue of the Americas, FL 9
New York, NY 10013, USA
If wish to stop receiving this newsletter, please send us an email at 
info@aleria.tech
. If you wish to stop receiving all Aleria-related communications, please use the Unsubscribe link below.
You received this email because you're subscribed to messages from Aleria.
Click here to 
Unsubscribe
 or 
Manage Preferences
 from all future emails.

subject: A Special Deal and Holiday Wishes
body:
"Measuring Inclusion" Kindle edition is just $0.99 - grab a bunch of copies!  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

The holidays are here, and we've got something special for you! 
We slashed the price of 
Measuring Inclusion: Higher profits & happier people, without guesswork or backlash
.
Only $0.99 on Kindle—now through December 24, 2024
With insightful analysis and practical guidance, 
Measuring Inclusion
 offers a unique approach that helps organizations identify meaningful DEI initiatives that drive financial returns 
and
 greater, sustainable diversity, while avoiding the backlash and legal challenges.
 
 
In today's anti-DEI climate, we believe it's more important than ever to spread the word about 
Measuring Inclusion
.
Share copies with your leaders and managers, clients, partners, and anyone else who could benefit from a new way of thinking about DEI—and what to do about it. 
Measuring Inclusion
 makes a great holiday gift, and you can use extra copies to support your own activities and promotions in 2025 & beyond.
Stock up while the deal lasts!
 
🎄🌟 
Wishing you a joyful holiday season 
🎄🌟
Here's to a bright and inclusive New Year ahead!
~The Aleria Team

subject: DEI slide continues as 2024 ends
body:
Also: Get our book for just $0.99. The economics of women athletes. ERGs drive business.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 December 17, 2024
This is our last newsletter of 2024. Give yourself (and us) a holiday present by grabbing a copy of 
Measuring Inclusion
 for just $0.99—details below.
 
Meanwhile, we seem to be ending the year on a negative note, with increasing lawsuits and other actions against DEI. But we remain optimistic that this is still a correction after the burst of interest in 2020-2022, and that before long people will realize that pumping millions of dollars into killing DEI is not just heartless, it's idiotic. If you don't like DEI, then how about using your energy to figure out what's wrong, and making it better?
 
Enjoy the holiday break and try not to let the bad news get to you. Here is hoping that 2025 starts on a more positive trend.
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them!
President Biden designated a new national monument in honor of 
Frances Perkins
, the first female secretary of labor in history, who masterminded many of our social support structures. Speaking of firsts, 
congratulations to Alex Consani
 for being the first transgender woman to win 
Model of the Year
. Also good to hear that 
streaming content with more diverse representation
 is receiving more positive reviews.
 
 
Aleria Team Updates
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Ready to start your 
Journey to Inclusion
?
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. Our four-stage 
Journey to Inclusion
 is ideally suited for organizations with 500 or more employees, regardless of your current level of DEI readiness. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities
On January 15, 2025 at 2:00 PM US/ET, join panelists from the Navy Federal Credit Union for “How to Promote Employee Mental Health,” a conversation about the importance of mental health in the workplace. Brought to you by our friends at FairyGodBoss, 
free registration
.
NOTE: as we approach the end of 2024 😱😱 the talk schedule is getting a bit lighter. As a reminder, if you have any events you'd like to see mentioned here, please 
drop us a note
. We focus on events that are free, or that offer a significant discount to our newsletter subscribers.
 
Spread the love!
If you enjoy the Aleria newsletter, forward it to a friend or colleague!
If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.

subject: The Vanguard 529 can help you fund your loved ones' education goals
body:
Start the new year on a solid foundation
 
You handle the holiday season. We've got a plan that can help with saving for education.
How you finish the year can be just as important as how you started it.
One way to end the year on a strong note is by opening and contributing to a Vanguard 529 Plan account.* As a plan built for education savings, it can help you save more money toward your loved ones' futures.
Read the benefits
Why one parent chose The Vanguard 529
"As soon as my daughter was born, I opened a 529 for her. The student loans that my wife and I have to pay are the price of admission. My daughter won't have to do that."
—DaJuan L., Vanguard crew member and client
Note: The experience of this Vanguard client may not be representative of the experience of other Vanguard clients and is not a guarantee of future investment performance or success.
Here's why it may be smart to open an account before the year ends:
The sooner you open an account, the more opportunities your money has to grow. And the earnings are tax-free if you use them for qualified expenses.
1
You may be able to lower your state tax liability for the current year.
2
You may be able to apply your 529 contributions toward this year's gift tax exclusions—up to $18,000 (or $36,000 if filing jointly) per beneficiary in 2024.
Big dreams are achieved one step at a time. Step into the new year with The Vanguard 529.
We've made saving for education easier by reducing the minimum requirement.
Explore The Vanguard 529
*There are many ways to save for education. 
Learn more
 about your options to see which one fits your goals best.
 
Connect with us
®
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
Earnings on nonqualified withdrawals may be subject to federal income tax and a 10% federal penalty tax, as well as state and local income taxes. The availability of tax or other benefits may be contingent on meeting other requirements. State tax treatment of withdrawals used for i) expenses for tuition in connection with enrollments or attendance at an elementary or secondary public, private, or religious school ii) expenses related to apprenticeship programs, or iii) student loan repayments is determined by the state(s) where the taxpayer files state income tax. If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, please consult with a tax advisor.
2
The availability of tax or other benefits may be contingent on meeting other requirements.
All investing is subject to risk, including the possible loss of the money you invest.
For more information about The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan, visit 
vanguard‍.‍com
 to obtain a Program Description, which includes investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other information; read and consider it carefully before investing. Vanguard Marketing Corporation, Distributor.
If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, consider before investing whether your or the designated beneficiary's home state offers any state tax or other benefits that are only available for investments in such state's qualified tuition program. Other state benefits may include financial aid, scholarship funds, and protection from creditors.
The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan is a Nevada Trust administered by the office of the Nevada State Treasurer.
The Vanguard Group, Inc., serves as the Investment Manager for The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan and through its affiliate, Vanguard Marketing Corporation, markets and distributes the Plan. Ascensus Broker Dealer Services, LLC, serves as Program Manager and has overall responsibility for the day-to-day operations. The Plan's portfolios, although they invest in Vanguard mutual funds, are not mutual funds. Investment returns are not guaranteed, and you could lose money by investing in the Plan.

subject: Reminder: Heartache to Hope Workshop Coming Dec. 19th
body:
Learn More About The Session
 
INTRODUCTION TO THE WORKSHOP
🌟 
From Heartache to Hope: Building Safer Spaces for Tough Conversations
 🌟
Are you ready to transform tough conversations into opportunities for healing and growth? This 2.5-hour workshop will equip you with the skills to navigate challenging dialogues with empathy, respect, and confidence.
What You’ll Learn:
✅ Create safe environments for open communication.
✅ Handle emotional moments with care and understanding.
✅ Build trust and connection, even during difficult conversations.
Let’s move from discomfort to hope—together. 💛
📅 Date: Thursday, December 19th
Time: 10 AM - 12:30 PM CST
📍 Location: Zoom
🔗 Register here: 
Pay $157 Now
 
 
Meet The Facilitators
Phyllis Braxton, LGSW, MSW, MEd., was born and raised in the segregated south on the Gulf Coast of Mississippi on the heels of the civil rights movement. Phyllis has used her platform as an intercultural and intellectual activist and a catalyst for individual and organizational change. Her work in the DEI field and broader community unapologetically centers the injustices to Black women and girls. She resides in North Minneapolis, Minnesota. She is determined to leave a legacy of mental wellness generational transformation for racially, economically, and educationally disadvantaged women and girls globally through her nonprofit, 
wholeSOUL, Inc.
Omkar Sawardekar, MSW, LICSW, is a Therapist, Trainer, Intercultural Coach, and Organizational Consultant. Omkar supports his clients to live into their respective missions more holistically by integrating the lenses of identity, culture, mental health, and trauma. Driven by the tenets that the relational container is the foundation for transformative change and that the most impactful practices grow from interdisciplinary methodologies, Omkar is committed to working collaboratively to promote culturally responsive approaches. Omkar is drawn to addressing the most complex cultural and systemic challenges throughout his work with individuals, groups, and organizations.
Inquire about group pricing:
omkar@omkarsawardekar.com
﻿

Dustin 💫 Find talent easier than ever - and get 50% off - with the revolutionary casting system preferred by professionals
 
 
Professional Casting Tools 
Tailored to Your Needs
 
We know that every project is different, and your casting needs can change from one production to the next.
That's why we've designed a fast, dynamic, and customizable 
Casting System
 using feedback from hundreds of top industry professionals, making the hiring process easier and more efficient than ever before — for productions of all types, of every scope, anywhere in the world.
 
Post a Job to Get Started
 
Our Industry Leading Tools:
 
Advanced Search Tools
Quickly browse through 
more than 400,000 profiles
 to find the right talent for your productions. Advanced filters make this a breeze.
Try a search
 
Custom Workflows
Each of your project's Application Managers let you easily organize candidates into distinct workflow folders and shortlists. Plus, applications are automatically organized by role. And you can easily apply filters and toggle between view schemes to fully customize your experience.
Learn more
 
Messaging
Easily contact actors — individually or in bulk — from your Application Manager after you post a job. And use the Talent Database to quickly invite more actors to apply. Associate your messages with specific projects to stay organized. 
Go ahead, reach out.
Learn more
 
Collaboration
Invite your clients and colleagues to collaborate on the casting process. Grant access to your project's full application manager, or choose to only share specific shortlists. Attend virtual auditions together, share audition recordings, and compare feedback.
Learn more
How Backstage Works for Creators 
Post a Job
List your jobs and casting calls to immediately broadcast your project to an unparalleled talent network. Focus your search locally or globally.
Find Talent
Quickly and easily filter, review, and respond to applications. And hand-select additional talent to invite to apply from our Talent Database.
Cast Your Project
Organize applications, create shortlists, work with collaborators, schedule auditions, and book the best talent for your project.
 
Thank you,
 
VP of Casting
Access Your Casting System Today
 
Backstage, 2300 Empire Avenue 5th Floor, Burbank, CA 91504, United States, 1-800-918-8307

subject: Heartache to Hope Workshop Coming Dec. 19th
body:
Learn More About The Session
 
INTRODUCTION TO THE WORKSHOP
🌟 
From Heartache to Hope: Building Safer Spaces for Tough Conversations
 🌟
Are you ready to transform tough conversations into opportunities for healing and growth? This 2.5-hour workshop will equip you with the skills to navigate challenging dialogues with empathy, respect, and confidence.
What You’ll Learn:
✅ Create safe environments for open communication.
✅ Handle emotional moments with care and understanding.
✅ Build trust and connection, even during difficult conversations.
Let’s move from discomfort to hope—together. 💛
📅 Date: Thursday, December 19th
Time: 10 AM - 12:30 PM CST
📍 Location: Zoom
🔗 Register here: 
Pay $157 Now
 
 
Meet The Facilitators
Phyllis Braxton, LGSW, MSW, MEd., was born and raised in the segregated south on the Gulf Coast of Mississippi on the heels of the civil rights movement. Phyllis has used her platform as an intercultural and intellectual activist and a catalyst for individual and organizational change. Her work in the DEI field and broader community unapologetically centers the injustices to Black women and girls. She resides in North Minneapolis, Minnesota. She is determined to leave a legacy of mental wellness generational transformation for racially, economically, and educationally disadvantaged women and girls globally through her nonprofit, 
wholeSOUL, Inc.
Omkar Sawardekar, MSW, LICSW, is a Therapist, Trainer, Intercultural Coach, and Organizational Consultant. Omkar supports his clients to live into their respective missions more holistically by integrating the lenses of identity, culture, mental health, and trauma. Driven by the tenets that the relational container is the foundation for transformative change and that the most impactful practices grow from interdisciplinary methodologies, Omkar is committed to working collaboratively to promote culturally responsive approaches. Omkar is drawn to addressing the most complex cultural and systemic challenges throughout his work with individuals, groups, and organizations.
Inquire about group pricing:
omkar@omkarsawardekar.com
﻿

4048 Lakeland Ave N Suite 2218

Minneapolis, MN 55422 US

subject: The Vanguard 529 can help your loved ones achieve their education dreams
body:
End the year on a strong note
 
You handle the holiday season. We've got a plan that can help with saving for education.
How you finish the year can be just as important as how you started it.
One way to end the year on a strong note is by opening and contributing to a Vanguard 529 Plan account.* As a plan built for education savings, it can help you save more money toward your loved ones' futures.
Read the benefits
Why one parent chose The Vanguard 529
"As soon as my daughter was born, I opened a 529 for her. The student loans that my wife and I have to pay are the price of admission. My daughter won't have to do that."
—DaJuan L., Vanguard crew member and client
Note: The experience of this Vanguard client may not be representative of the experience of other Vanguard clients and is not a guarantee of future investment performance or success.
Here's why it may be smart to open an account before the year ends:
The sooner you open an account, the more opportunities your money has to grow. And the earnings are tax-free if you use them for qualified expenses.
1
You may be able to lower your state tax liability for the current year.
2
You may be able to apply your 529 contributions toward this year's gift tax exclusions—up to $18,000 (or $36,000 if filing jointly) per beneficiary in 2024.
Big dreams are achieved one step at a time. Step into the new year with The Vanguard 529.
We've made saving for education easier by reducing the minimum requirement.
Explore The Vanguard 529
*There are many ways to save for education. 
Learn more
 about your options to see which one fits your goals best.
 
Connect with us
®
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
Earnings on nonqualified withdrawals may be subject to federal income tax and a 10% federal penalty tax, as well as state and local income taxes. The availability of tax or other benefits may be contingent on meeting other requirements. State tax treatment of withdrawals used for i) expenses for tuition in connection with enrollments or attendance at an elementary or secondary public, private, or religious school ii) expenses related to apprenticeship programs, or iii) student loan repayments is determined by the state(s) where the taxpayer files state income tax. If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, please consult with a tax advisor.
2
The availability of tax or other benefits may be contingent on meeting other requirements.
All investing is subject to risk, including the possible loss of the money you invest.
For more information about The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan, visit 
vanguard‍.‍com
 to obtain a Program Description, which includes investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other information; read and consider it carefully before investing. Vanguard Marketing Corporation, Distributor.
If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, consider before investing whether your or the designated beneficiary's home state offers any state tax or other benefits that are only available for investments in such state's qualified tuition program. Other state benefits may include financial aid, scholarship funds, and protection from creditors.
The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan is a Nevada Trust administered by the office of the Nevada State Treasurer.
The Vanguard Group, Inc., serves as the Investment Manager for The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan and through its affiliate, Vanguard Marketing Corporation, markets and distributes the Plan. Ascensus Broker Dealer Services, LLC, serves as Program Manager and has overall responsibility for the day-to-day operations. The Plan's portfolios, although they invest in Vanguard mutual funds, are not mutual funds. Investment returns are not guaranteed, and you could lose money by investing in the Plan.

subject: You could be missing out on earning more money each month
body:
Is it time to update your savings, Dustin Puehler?
 
When it comes to savings, it's 
accrual
 world out there—you might be missing out
Imagine that you're losing out on 8x more earnings.* That's what you're doing by keeping your savings in a traditional account.
Build my savings
Let's make saving more interest-ing
We believe everyone deserves more from their savings. That's why we introduced the Cash Plus Account, designed to outshine traditional banking options to maximize your financial benefits.
With the Vanguard Cash Plus Account, you have:
Access to a competitive 3.90% annual percentage yield.*
No minimum balance
 requirement.
FDIC coverage up to 1.25 
(and 2.5 for joint accounts).***
Online transactions, direct deposit
, and 
bill payment
 capabilities.
The option to 
diversify into 5 Vanguard money market funds
—with a holistic view of your cash and investments.
It's time to save the Vanguard way.
Learn more
 
Connect with us
®
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
*The Vanguard Cash Plus bank sweep program APY (annual percentage yield) is 3.90% as of November 8, 2024. The APY will vary and may change at any time. Source for average bank savings yield of 0.45%: FDIC National Rates and Rate Caps as of October 21, 2024.
**This example is hypothetical and for illustrative purposes only and does not represent the return on any particular investment. It assumes that money is invested for one month at the current rate and that no additional transactions are made, and it does not factor in compounding. It is based on an estimate of total interest using the Vanguard Cash Plus sweep program 3.90% APY (annual percentage yield will vary and may change at any time) as of November 8, 2024, and average bank savings yield of 0.45% as of October 21, 2024 (Source: FDIC National Rates and Rate Caps). The Vanguard Cash Plus Account is a brokerage account offered by Vanguard Brokerage Services, a division of Vanguard Marketing Corporation, member FINRA. There may be other material differences between products that must be considered prior to investing. All investing is subject to risk. For more information about the Vanguard Cash Plus Account, visit 
https://investor.vanguard.com/accounts-plans/vanguard-cash-plus-account
.
***Bank Sweep program balances are held at one or more Program Banks and are not cash balances held by Vanguard Brokerage Services (VBS), earn a variable rate of interest, and are not securities covered by SIPC. Bank Sweep deposits are covered by FDIC insurance up to $250,000 per insurable category of ownership at each Program Bank when aggregated with all other deposits held by you at such bank and in the same insurable category. VBS will aggregate and allocate Bank Sweep deposits to Program Banks across Vanguard Cash Plus and Vanguard Cash Deposit with identically registered accounts to offer maximum FDIC coverage up to $1.25 million for individual and trust accounts and $2.5 million for joint accounts when at least 5 Program Banks are utilized. VBS will aggregate and allocate Bank Sweep deposits for trust accounts at the account level and not at the beneficiary level. FDIC coverage may be decreased based on Program Bank limits and whether you've opted out of any Program Banks and is subject to applicable FDIC coverage limits. 
You are solely responsible for monitoring the aggregate amount that you have on deposit at each Program Bank in connection with FDIC limits, including through other accounts at VBS.
 See the 
Vanguard Bank Sweep Products Terms of Use
 and 
list of participating Program Banks
 for more information. For more information about FDIC insurance coverage, please visit 
fdic.gov
.
For more information about Vanguard funds or Vanguard ETFs, visit vanguard​.​com to obtain a prospectus or, if available, a summary prospectus. Investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other important information are contained in the prospectus; read and consider it carefully before investing.
The Vanguard Cash Plus Account is a brokerage account offered by Vanguard Brokerage Services, a division of Vanguard Marketing Corporation, member FINRA and SIPC. Under the Sweep Program, Eligible Balances swept to Program Banks are not securities: they are not covered by SIPC, but are eligible for FDIC insurance, subject to applicable limits. Money market funds held in the account are not guaranteed or insured by the FDIC, but are securities eligible for SIPC coverage. See the 
Vanguard Bank Sweep Products Terms of Use
 and 
Program Bank list
 for more information.
Bank savings accounts may have characteristics that differentiate them from bank sweep programs offered by Vanguard Cash Plus. For example, they may offer overdraft protection, ATM access (immediate access to your money), and other convenience features. Each company's products differ, so it's important to ask questions to understand account features.
There may be other material differences between products that must be considered prior to investing.
All investing is subject to risk, including possible loss of principal.

subject: Heartache to Hope Workshop Coming Dec. 19th
body:
Meet The Facilitators
 
 
Register for our Next Session:
 
 
 
REGISTER
 
 
In the midst of polarization, conflict, and fragmentation, we need support, frameworks, tools, and practice.
Get to know Phyllis and Omkar as we share a bit about our approach to more effectively engaging across deep differences.
Born and raised in the segregated south on the Gulf Coast of Mississippi on the heels of the civil rights movement, Phyllis has used her platform as an intercultural and intellectual activist and a catalyst for individual and organizational change. Her work in the DEI field and broader community unapologetically centers the injustices to Black women and girls. She resides in North Minneapolis, Minnesota. She is determined to leave a legacy of mental wellness generational transformation for racially, economically, and educationally disadvantaged women and girls globally through her nonprofit, 
wholeSOUL, Inc.
Omkar Sawardekar, MSW, LICSW, is a Therapist, Trainer, Intercultural Coach, and Organizational Consultant. Omkar supports his clients to live into their respective missions more holistically by integrating the lenses of identity, culture, mental health, and trauma. Driven by the tenets that the relational container is the foundation for transformative change and that the most impactful practices grow from interdisciplinary methodologies, Omkar is committed to working collaboratively to promote culturally responsive approaches. Omkar is drawn to addressing the most complex cultural and systemic challenges throughout his work with individuals, groups, and organizations.
Inquire about group pricing:
omkar@omkarsawardekar.com
﻿
  
  
 
 
REGISTER
 
 
PINK Consulting, LLC | 
4048 Lakeland Ave N Suite 2218
 6512263934 | 
Minneapolis, MN 55422 US

subject: Does your savings earn over 8x more than the average bank?
body:
There's a smarter way to save
 
When it comes to savings, it's 
accrual
 world out there—you might be missing out
Imagine that you're losing out on 8x more earnings.* That's what you're doing by keeping your savings in a traditional account.
Build my savings
Let's make saving more interest-ing
We believe everyone deserves more from their savings. That's why we introduced the Cash Plus Account, designed to outshine traditional banking options to maximize your financial benefits.
With the Vanguard Cash Plus Account, you have:
Access to a competitive 3.90% annual percentage yield.*
No minimum balance
 requirement.
FDIC coverage up to 1.25 
(and 2.5 for joint accounts).***
Online transactions, direct deposit
, and 
bill payment
 capabilities.
The option to 
diversify into 5 Vanguard money market funds
—with a holistic view of your cash and investments.
It's time to save the Vanguard way.
Learn more
 
Connect with us
®
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
*The Vanguard Cash Plus bank sweep program APY (annual percentage yield) is 3.90% as of November 8, 2024. The APY will vary and may change at any time. Source for average bank savings yield of 0.45%: FDIC National Rates and Rate Caps as of October 21, 2024.
**This example is hypothetical and for illustrative purposes only and does not represent the return on any particular investment. It assumes that money is invested for one month at the current rate and that no additional transactions are made, and it does not factor in compounding. It is based on an estimate of total interest using the Vanguard Cash Plus sweep program 3.90% APY (annual percentage yield will vary and may change at any time) as of November 8, 2024, and average bank savings yield of 0.45% as of October 21, 2024 (Source: FDIC National Rates and Rate Caps). The Vanguard Cash Plus Account is a brokerage account offered by Vanguard Brokerage Services, a division of Vanguard Marketing Corporation, member FINRA. There may be other material differences between products that must be considered prior to investing. All investing is subject to risk. For more information about the Vanguard Cash Plus Account, visit 
https://investor.vanguard.com/accounts-plans/vanguard-cash-plus-account
.
***Bank Sweep program balances are held at one or more Program Banks and are not cash balances held by Vanguard Brokerage Services (VBS), earn a variable rate of interest, and are not securities covered by SIPC. Bank Sweep deposits are covered by FDIC insurance up to $250,000 per insurable category of ownership at each Program Bank when aggregated with all other deposits held by you at such bank and in the same insurable category. VBS will aggregate and allocate Bank Sweep deposits to Program Banks across Vanguard Cash Plus and Vanguard Cash Deposit with identically registered accounts to offer maximum FDIC coverage up to $1.25 million for individual and trust accounts and $2.5 million for joint accounts when at least 5 Program Banks are utilized. VBS will aggregate and allocate Bank Sweep deposits for trust accounts at the account level and not at the beneficiary level. FDIC coverage may be decreased based on Program Bank limits and whether you've opted out of any Program Banks and is subject to applicable FDIC coverage limits. 
You are solely responsible for monitoring the aggregate amount that you have on deposit at each Program Bank in connection with FDIC limits, including through other accounts at VBS.
 See the 
Vanguard Bank Sweep Products Terms of Use
 and 
list of participating Program Banks
 for more information. For more information about FDIC insurance coverage, please visit 
fdic.gov
.
For more information about Vanguard funds or Vanguard ETFs, visit vanguard​.​com to obtain a prospectus or, if available, a summary prospectus. Investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other important information are contained in the prospectus; read and consider it carefully before investing.
The Vanguard Cash Plus Account is a brokerage account offered by Vanguard Brokerage Services, a division of Vanguard Marketing Corporation, member FINRA and SIPC. Under the Sweep Program, Eligible Balances swept to Program Banks are not securities: they are not covered by SIPC, but are eligible for FDIC insurance, subject to applicable limits. Money market funds held in the account are not guaranteed or insured by the FDIC, but are securities eligible for SIPC coverage. See the 
Vanguard Bank Sweep Products Terms of Use
 and 
Program Bank list
 for more information.
Bank savings accounts may have characteristics that differentiate them from bank sweep programs offered by Vanguard Cash Plus. For example, they may offer overdraft protection, ATM access (immediate access to your money), and other convenience features. Each company's products differ, so it's important to ask questions to understand account features.
There may be other material differences between products that must be considered prior to investing.
All investing is subject to risk, including possible loss of principal.
We recommend that you consult a tax or financial advisor about your individual situation.
Did you hear?
 You can safeguard your Vanguard account and stay up to date on important activities by enrolling in text alerts. Simply go to your 
Account alert settings

subject: Register Now: Last Chance to Join our Adobe Learning Manager Webinar
body:
Feed your mind with insights on AI, personalization, and Adobe Learning Manager’s latest updates! 
Click here 
to view this message in a browser window 
 
AI-Powered Learning for the Modern Workforce
 
 
 
Thursday, December 12, 2024
 
 
1:00pm ET; 10:00am PT
60 minutes
 
Online
Register Now
 
 
Hello Dustin,
 
We hope you had a fantastic Thanksgiving filled with good food and good company. While you're digesting all those leftovers, why not 
join us for a 
c
omplimentary webinar
?
 
In today's rapidly evolving learning landscape, leveraging the latest technologies is key to delivering impactful training. This session will explore how Adobe Learning Manager (ALM) integrates AI, Machine Learning, and personalized experiences to meet your learners' unique needs.
 
Specifically, attendees will learn:
How AI and Machine Learning drive smarter, adaptive learning pathways in ALM
Strategies for fostering collaboration through social learning environments
Steps to create personalized learning plans and custom catalogs for your organization
About ALM’s latest UI facelift and how it enhances user engagement
Register Now
 
 
Samuel Netter

subject: Drive Performance with Data-driven Insights (3 of 5)
body:
Optimize your training programs with Promote's reporting features. 
 
— Email 3 of 5 —
 
How Do You Measure
Training Success?
 
  
Hi Dustin, 
 
Proving the impact of your training programs is key – not just to track progress but to refine strategies and deliver lasting results.
 
Yet, gathering and analyzing data can feel overwhelming without the right tools.
 
Here’s how Promote helps transform these challenges into solutions.
  
Turn Data Into
Actionable Insights
Promote’s reporting features make it simple to monitor key metrics like 
completion rates
, 
performance trends
, and 
learner behavior
. 
 
With these insights, you can:
 
Track progres
s to ensure your programs are on course.
Identify trends
 that help optimize learning strategies.
Showcase measurable impact
 to stakeholders with confidence.
With Promote, measuring and improving the effectiveness of your programs has never been easier.
  
See the Results
in Action
 
Discover how Atlas Copco leveraged the Promote platform to drive measurable results and gain actionable insights for continuous improvement.
Read the Case Study
 
  
  
In our next email, we’ll 
explore how
 
easy it is to get started with Promote
. Stay curious and keep an eye on your inbox!
Best regards,
 
  
 
Dean Olivier
Platform Specialist
 
PROMOTE INTERNATIONAL
Slussplan 9
111 30 Stockholm, Sweden

subject: Reminder: IN CASE YOU MISSED IT! Heartache to Hope Workshop Coming Dec. 19th
body:
Meet The Facilitators
 
 
Register for our Next Session:
 
 
 
REGISTER
 
 
In Case You Missed Our Last One (VIDEO):
﻿
 
In the midst of polarization, conflict, and fragmentation, we need support, frameworks, tools, and practice.
Get to know Phyllis and Omkar as we share a bit about our approach to more effectively engaging across deep differences.
Born and raised in the segregated south on the Gulf Coast of Mississippi on the heels of the civil rights movement, Phyllis has used her platform as an intercultural and intellectual activist and a catalyst for individual and organizational change. Her work in the DEI field and broader community unapologetically centers the injustices to Black women and girls. She resides in North Minneapolis, Minnesota. She is determined to leave a legacy of mental wellness generational transformation for racially, economically, and educationally disadvantaged women and girls globally through her nonprofit, 
wholeSOUL, Inc.
Omkar Sawardekar, MSW, LICSW, is a Therapist, Trainer, Intercultural Coach, and Organizational Consultant. Omkar supports his clients to live into their respective missions more holistically by integrating the lenses of identity, culture, mental health, and trauma. Driven by the tenets that the relational container is the foundation for transformative change and that the most impactful practices grow from interdisciplinary methodologies, Omkar is committed to working collaboratively to promote culturally responsive approaches. Omkar is drawn to addressing the most complex cultural and systemic challenges throughout his work with individuals, groups, and organizations.
Register for our NEW Workshop:
 
Inquire about group pricing:
omkar@omkarsawardekar.com
﻿
REGISTER FOR DEC 19TH

4048 Lakeland Ave N Suite 2218

subject: Our work wins a “Goody Business Book” award!
body:
Also: quantifying the ROI of inclusion; Jim Crow 2.0?; the discrimination paradox.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 December 03, 2024
It is becoming increasingly clear that the next several years will not be “business as usual” for DEI supporters, and more generally for organizations of all stripes struggling to manage their talent in an increasingly complex world. We firmly believe that every challenge represents an opportunity. We are optimistic that our approach, as described in our 
award-winning book
, will help organizations learn the value of treating all employees fairly and with respect. Ultimately, it is the marriage of higher profits and happier people that will lead to the profound, systemic change we need for more successful companies and a better, more inclusive and equitable society.
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them!
Start the holiday season with a bit of cheer when you read about how a 
centuries-old market
 in Berlin, Germany, is embracing cultural and other forms of diversity. Then hop across the Atlantic to Boston University, where the 
Computing & Data Sciences program
 boasts 47% women thanks to its inclusive approach to CS education. Lastly, kudos to the 
Second Change Business Coalition
, which works with dozens of private-sector employers 
to create job opportunities
 for people with criminal records. Their work provides opportunities for this overlooked and underappreciated segment of our society.
 
 
Aleria Team Updates
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Ready to start your 
Journey to Inclusion
?
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. Our four-stage 
Journey to Inclusion
 is ideally suited for organizations with 500 or more employees, regardless of your current level of DEI readiness. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities
On December 4, 2024 at 12:00 PM US/ET, join Patricia Arroyo and and Tina Chappell for "Wanted: 5 Good Men--Male Leaders Advancing Inclusion," a webinar that addresses the critical issue of inclusion by examining the role male executives can have. 
Free registration.
On January 15, 2025 at 2:00 PM US/ET, join panelists from the Navy Federal Credit Union for “How to Promote Employee Mental Health,” a conversation about the importance of mental health in the workplace. Brought to you by our friends at FairyGodBoss, 
free registration
.
NOTE: as we approach the end of 2024 😱😱 the talk schedule is getting a bit lighter. As a reminder, if you have any events you'd like to see mentioned here, please 
drop us a note
. We focus on events that are free, or that offer a significant discount to our newsletter subscribers.
 
Spread the love!
If you enjoy the Aleria newsletter, forward it to a friend or colleague!
If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.
SUBSCRIBE
101 Avenue of the Americas, FL 9
New York, NY 10013, USA
If wish to stop receiving this newsletter, please send us an email at 
info@aleria.tech
. If you wish to stop receiving all Aleria-related communications, please use the Unsubscribe link below.
You received this email because you're subscribed to messages from Aleria.
Click here to 
Unsubscribe
 or 
Manage Preferences
 from all future emails.

subject: Enhance Facilitation with AI Features (2 of 5)
body:
Learn how Promote's AI features can streamline your facilitation process and boost learner engagement. 
  
— Email 2 of 5 —
 
Enhance Facilitation
with 
AI Features
  
 
  
Hello again Dustin,
 
Delivering multiple training programs and providing timely, meaningful feedback can be a challenge. That’s where Promote’s AI features come in – they’re designed to streamline your workflow, saving you time and boosting learner engagement. 
  
Here’s how our
 AI tools
can make a difference:
AI-Generated 
Replies
Providing individualized feedback is key to guiding and motivating learners, but it can be time-consuming. Our AI Assistance generates 
personalized, contextually appropriate replies
, making it easier to keep learners on track and engaged.
 
AI-generated 
Summaries
Sifting through lively discussions for key insights is rewarding yet demanding. Our AI tool can create 
concise summaries of learner interactions
, helping you provide valuable overviews without spending extra time.
  
Exclusive Access to
Our Interactive Demo
  
Try out these AI features firsthand! 
You’ll step into a facilitator’s role in our mock-up leadership program, exploring how these tools support seamless, impactful learning.
Try Out the Platform
 
  
 
  
Next time, we’ll dive into how Promote’s 
data-driven insights can drive performance
 in your training programs. Stay curious and keep an eye on your inbox!
Best Regards,
 
  
 
Dean Olivier
Platform Specialist
 
PROMOTE INTERNATIONAL
Slussplan 9
111 30 Stockholm, Sweden 
  
P.S. Curious to see Promote in action?
Just hit reply, and I’ll arrange a guided tour for you!
  
 
Message sent by Promote International at Slussplan 9, 111 30 Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden.
 
Don't want to receive emails from us? Manage your email preferences 
here.

Born and raised in the segregated south on the Gulf Coast of Mississippi on the heels of the civil rights movement, Phyllis has used her platform as an intercultural and intellectual activist and a catalyst for individual and organizational change. Her work in the DEI field and broader community unapologetically centers the injustices to Black women and girls. She resides in North Minneapolis, Minnesota. She is determined to leave a legacy of mental wellness generational transformation for racially, economically, and educationally disadvantaged women and girls globally through her nonprofit, 
wholeSOUL, Inc.
Omkar Sawardekar, MSW, LICSW, is a Therapist, Trainer, Intercultural Coach, and Organizational Consultant. Omkar supports his clients to live into their respective missions more holistically by integrating the lenses of identity, culture, mental health, and trauma. Driven by the tenets that the relational container is the foundation for transformative change and that the most impactful practices grow from interdisciplinary methodologies, Omkar is committed to working collaboratively to promote culturally responsive approaches. Omkar is drawn to addressing the most complex cultural and systemic challenges throughout his work with individuals, groups, and organizations.

omkar@omkarsawardekar.com

subject: Local Casting, Simplified ★ Find The Best Talent Near You
body:
Dustin, Post a FREE listing today - cast locally or nationwide. Easily identify the best talent in your city for every role
 
Find the best talent near you
 
Create a local casting call 
with 
these 
easy steps: 
 
When posting a listing, choose a 
specific city
 (or any combination of cities) where you'd like to receive applications from. We'll automatically alert matching talent in your areas of interest.
 
A few out-of-towners might still apply, but you can choose the 
"Only send notifications for local and in-state submissions"
 option to ensure you're 
only notified about local applicants
 from the areas you specified.
 
You can also use your project's Application Manager to easily filter through candidates based on their 
distance from any city
 you choose.
 
If you'd like to expand your search, you can always add more cities, or even skip the local casting options and instead choose 
"
Nationwide
" 
or 
"
Worldwide
."
Click to learn more
Start finding talent today
 
Thank you

subject: Happy Thanksgiving from Prosperity Ready! 🦃
body:
Dear Dustin
As we gather with loved ones this Thanksgiving, we at Prosperity Ready want to take a moment to express our gratitude for you—our supporters, volunteers, and community partners. Your dedication has been the cornerstone of our mission.
This year, we are especially thankful as we embark on an exciting new chapter. We’re delighted to share that we are close to finding a new home for Prosperity Ready.
We’ll have more updates to share in the coming weeks, but for now, we celebrate the progress we’ve made together and look forward to what’s ahead.
On this day of gratitude, we are reminded of the incredible power of community and the impact we can achieve when we work together.
Thank you for being an essential part of the Prosperity Ready journey. We wish you and your loved ones a joyful and peaceful Thanksgiving.
Warm regards,
Lisa Perez
CEO
Prosperity Ready

subject: Visualize Your Learning Journeys with Promote (1 of 5)
body:
Discover how our digital learning platform can transform your training programs. 
— Email 1 of 5 —
 
Maximize the Impact
from Your Training
 
  
Hi Dustin,
 
It's Dean, a platform specialist at Promote International. I’m reaching out with a short series of emails to share how the 
Promote platform 
can help training professionals like you deliver impactful, behavior-focused learning experiences.
 
Why am I sharing this? 
Because I know how challenging it can be to manage multiple tools, track progress, and keep learners engaged – all while trying to demonstrate real results.
 
That’s where Promote comes in.
  
Visualize Your
Learning Journeys
The Promote platform addresses these challenges by providing a clear and 
intuitive roadmap
 for learners to navigate their development, while 
facilitators gain powerful tools
 for managing and tracking progress. No more guesswork – just clear insights and actionable data.
 
Promote consolidates all assignments, learning materials, and reminders into 
one cohesive journey
, making it easy for learners and facilitators to stay organized and on track.
Explore the 
Promote Platform
Take a look at how the Promote platform can simplify your workflow and maximize results
Let's Explore!
 
  
Stay 
Tuned!
Keep an eye on your inbox for the next email in this series, where I’ll dive deeper into how Promote can simplify your training processes and save you time.
Best Regards,
 
  
 
Dean Olivier
Platform Specialist
 
PROMOTE INTERNATIONAL
Slussplan 9
111 30 Stockholm, Sweden 
  
P.S. Want to experience the platform today?
Try our interactive demo here!
  
 
Message sent by Promote International at Slussplan 9, 111 30 Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden.
 
Don't want to receive emails from us? Manage your email preferences 
here.

subject: Register Now: Gobble Up the Future of Learning with Adobe Learning Manager
body:
Feast on insights about AI-driven learning and Adobe Learning Manager's new User Interface (UI)! 
Click here 
to view this message in a browser window 
 
AI-Powered Learning for the Modern Workforce
 
 
 
Thursday, December 12, 2024
 
 
1:00pm ET; 10:00am PT
60 minutes
 
Online
Register Now
 
 
This Thanksgiving season, we're serving up more than just turkey - we're dishing out a feast of knowledge to help you future-proof your learning strategy.
 
Join us for a complimentary webinar
 where we'll carve into the latest updates in Adobe Learning Manager (ALM) and explore how cutting-edge technology like AI and Machine Learning can be the gravy to your impactful training efforts. 
 
Specifically, here's what's on the learning menu:
How AI and Machine Learning drive smarter, adaptive learning pathways in ALM
Strategies for fostering collaboration through social learning environments
Steps to create personalized learning plans and custom catalogs for your organization
About ALM’s latest UI facelift and how it enhances user engagement
 
Don't let your learning strategy go cold - 
pull up a seat at our table
 and stay ahead in this ever-evolving landscape!
 
Samuel Netter
571-662-3080
 
www.carahsoft.com/adobe

subject: Register Now: AI-Powered Learning for the Modern Workforce
body:
Unlock the future of training with AI and personalized learning in Adobe Learning Manager! 
Click here 
to view this message in a browser window 
 
AI-Powered Learning for the Modern Workforce
 
 
 
Thursday, December 12, 2024
 
 
1:00pm ET; 10:00am PT
60 minutes
 
Online
Register Now
 
 
In today’s rapidly evolving learning landscape, leveraging the latest technologies is key to delivering impactful training. 
Join us for a complimentary webinar
 as we explore how Adobe Learning Manager (ALM) integrates AI, Machine Learning, and personalized experiences to meet the unique needs of learners in all types of organizations. We’ll also reveal the latest User Interface (UI) updates, designed to enhance user experience and simplify management.
 
Specifically, attendees will learn:
How AI and Machine Learning drive smarter, adaptive learning pathways in ALM
Strategies for fostering collaboration through social learning environments
Steps to create personalized learning plans and custom catalogs for your organization
About ALM’s latest UI facelift and how it enhances user engagement
 
Don’t miss this opportunity
 to future-proof your learning strategy!
 
Samuel Netter

subject: Dustin Puehler, a 529 account can help unlock educational opportunities
body:
You can start investing in your loved one's education with $1,000
 
There's more to The Vanguard 529 than meets the eye
The Vanguard 529 Plan gives you flexibility to save not just for college, but also for private schools, apprenticeships, and trade schools.
It offers tax advantages including tax-free growth and tax-free withdrawals for qualified education expenses.
1
And if the child doesn't end up using the account, you can roll over unused money to their Roth IRA or change the beneficiary to another family member without tax penalties.
2
Explore education accounts
You can help set your loved one up for success with a minimum initial contribution of $1,000
As education costs continually rise, every dollar you save counts. We've lowered the cost of opening a Vanguard 529 Plan account from $3,000 to $1,000.
If you're a Nevada resident, you can open an account with a $500 minimum initial contribution.
Now you can take charge of your loved one's future by opening an account with just $1,000. It's a perfect way to start helping the child in your life discover their potential.
Open an account
The earlier you start, the more time is on your side
Getting a head start is smart, because time's a valuable asset when it comes to investing for education.
Starting early with 529 savings helps you potentially save even more because of the power of compounding. That's when the earnings on your initial investment generate their own earnings, offering you greater potential for growth.
$1,000 is a great start. Next you'll want to make a plan for how to keep investing over time to make the most of your account and help give your loved one access to the opportunities they deserve.
Why start now?
 
Connect with us
®
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
Earnings on nonqualified withdrawals may be subject to federal income tax and a 10% federal penalty tax, as well as state and local income taxes. The availability of tax or other benefits may be contingent on meeting other requirements.
 State tax treatment of withdrawals used for i) expenses for tuition in connection with enrollment or attendance at an elementary or secondary public, private, or religious school, ii) expenses related to apprenticeship programs, or iii) student loan repayments is determined by the state(s) where the taxpayer files state income tax.
 
If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, please consult with a tax advisor. State tax treatment of Roth IRA rollovers will also be determined by the applicable state.
2
Certain restrictions apply, including to whom the assets may be transferred, a required holding period of 15 years, and limits on rollovers of contributions made within the 5 years prior to the rollover.
 The annual rollover limit is subject to Roth IRA annual contribution limits with a lifetime limit of $35,000 for each 529 account beneficiary. Consult your tax advisor prior to initiating a rollover.
Legal notices
All investing is subject to risk, including the possible loss of the money you invest.
For more information about The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan, visit 
vanguard‍.‍com
 to obtain a Program Description, which includes investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other information; read and consider it carefully before investing. Vanguard Marketing Corporation, Distributor.
The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan is a Nevada Trust administered by the office of the Nevada State Treasurer.
The Vanguard Group, Inc., serves as the Investment Manager for The Vanguard 529 College Savings Plan and through its affiliate, Vanguard Marketing Corporation, markets and distributes the Plan. Ascensus Broker Dealer Services, LLC, serves as Program Manager and has overall responsibility for the day-to-day operations. The Plan's portfolios, although they invest in Vanguard mutual funds, are not mutual funds. Investment returns are not guaranteed, and you could lose money by investing in the Plan.
If you are not a Nevada taxpayer, consider before investing whether your or the designated beneficiary's home state offers any state tax or other benefits that are only available for investments in such state's qualified tuition program. Other state benefits may include financial aid, scholarship funds, and protection from creditors.
Did you hear?
 You can safeguard your Vanguard account and stay up to date on important activities by enrolling in text alerts. Simply go to your 
Account alert settings
 page and select the text alerts you want to receive.
Because you're a valued Vanguard client, we thought you'd be interested in this information. If you prefer not to receive emails of this type, simply 
email
 us. Please do not reply to this message to opt out.
The material in this message is promotional in nature.

P.O. Box 982901 | El Paso, TX 
79998-2901

offer

cost
 is
